text: Inclusion means for me a community and a society
where everyone has respect and regard for one another.
Having the same rights and ability
and spending power and presence in the community as everyone else.
Inclusion means to me opportunity to
do stuff on equal footing.
It means the opportunity for everyone to achieve their potential.
Looking at each person for who they are,
their skills, their abilities and what they can each bring to the community.
People with disabilities are
acknowledged for their rights.
Inclusion means that I can just go out there,
go wherever I want to go and do whatever I want to do.
I don’t want to be singled out because
I’m different, ‘cause I’m short or bald,
or because I wear hearing aids and I can’t hear.
It doesn’t matter if you’re different. You’re valuable.
I just want to be there and participate
like everybody else.
[Music plays]
[Screen reader speaks in the background]
Just trying to treat disability like a minor detail.
Giving someone the choice and making them feel empowered.
It’s taking into account
each and every person that we’re dealing with
and respecting that.
Recognise the humanity in people.
It is a community
where everyone who has a desire and ambition,
are supported and encouraged to follow it
and to dream big one and all.
I think we have the makings of
a really fantastic community that can continue
to lead Australia and hopefully the world.
[Music plays]
